query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
1 Sì come quando i primi raggi vibra 2 là dove il suo fattor lo sangue sparse, 3 cadendo Ibero sotto l’alta Libra,
query.error: **English:** 1 Just as when the first rays vibrate 2 where their maker shed his blood, 3 the Ebro falling beneath the high Libra,
query.result: 1 Swa swa ðonne ða forman gleamas glædas 2 ðær ðær heora Scyppend his blod ageat, 3 Ibero on underne ðære hean Lybran,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
4 e l’onde in Gange da nona rïarse, 5 sì stava il sole; onde ’l giorno sen giva, 6 come l’angel di Dio lieto ci apparse.
query.error: **English:** 4 and the waves in Ganges redden from the ninth hour, 5 so the sun stood; whence the day was departing, 6 when the angel of God appeared to us, joyful.
query.result: 4 and ða wægas on Gange ða niðan sind 5 on ðære nontide nearwe beoð, 6 swa ða sunne stod; ðanon ða dæg gewat,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
7 Fuor de la fiamma stava in su la riva, 8 e cantava ‘Beati mundo corde!’ 9 in voce assai più che la nostra viva.
query.error: **English:** 7 Outside of the flame he stood upon the shore, 8 and sang ‘Blessed are the pure in heart!’ 9 in a voice much more lively than ours.
query.result: 7 Utan ðære lige he stod ofer ðam ofre, 8 and song ‘Eadige ða clænan heortan!’ 9 on stefne micle ma þonne ure.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
10 Poscia «Più non si va, se pria non morde, 11 anime sante, il foco: intrate in esso, 12 e al cantar di là non siate sorde»,
query.error: **English:** 10 Then he said to us, as we drew near to him: 11 “Holy souls, no one goes further without first being bitten by the fire: enter it, 12 and do not be deaf to the singing on the other side.”
query.result: 10 Þa cwæð he us, swa we him neah gewurdon: 11 “Halge sawla, her ne gæð nan man furðor, 12 buton he ær ðone fyr gebite: gað in ðone,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
13 ci disse come noi li fummo presso; 14 per ch’io divenni tal, quando lo ’ntesi, 15 qual è colui che ne la fossa è messo.
query.error: **English:** 13 When I heard this, I became like someone who is thrown into a grave. 14 Because of this, I became so terrified when I heard it, 15 like someone who is thrown into a grave.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
16 In su le man commesse mi protesi, 17 guardando il foco e imaginando forte 18 umani corpi già veduti accesi.
query.error: **English:** 16 I stretched out my hands above the flames, 17 gazing at the fire and vividly imagining 18 human bodies that I had seen burning.
query.result: 16 Ic on ða honda me beah, 17 wlitigende ðone lig and ðone leoman, 18 monna lichoman ðe ic ær geseah.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
19 Volsersi verso me le buone scorte; 20 e Virgilio mi disse: «Figliuol mio, 21 qui può esser tormento, ma non morte.
query.error: **English:** 19 The good escorts turned towards me; 20 and Virgil said to me: "My son, 21 here there can be torment, but not death.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
22 Ricorditi, ricorditi! E se io 23 sovresso Gerïon ti guidai salvo, 24 che farò ora presso più a Dio?
query.error: **English:** 22 Remember, remember! And if I 23 guided you safely over Geryon, 24 what shall I do now that I am nearer to God?
query.result: 22 Gemuna, gemuna! And gif ic ðe ofer Geryones hrycg 23 gesundne gelædde, 24 hwæt sceal ic nu wyrcan, nu ic Gode nearra eom?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
25 Credi per certo che se dentro a l’alvo 26 di questa fiamma stessi ben mille anni, 27 non ti potrebbe far d’un capel calvo.
query.error: **English:** 25 Believe for certain that if you were to stay 26 inside this flame for a thousand years, 27 it could not make you lose a single hair.
query.result: 25 Soðlice gelyf ðæt ðeah ðu ðusend geara 26 on ðyses liges legere wære, 27 ne mihte ðe ðæt an loc ahydan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
28 E se tu forse credi ch’io t’inganni, 29 fatti ver’ lei, e fatti far credenza 30 con le tue mani al lembo d’i tuoi panni.
query.error: **English:** 28 And if perhaps you think that I deceive you, 29 turn to her, and have her give you proof 30 with your own hands on the hem of your clothes.
query.result: 28 And gif ðu wenst ðæt ic ðe wene, 29 gewend ðe to hire, and hio ðe mæg gecyðan 30 mid ðinum handum on ðinum reafes fnæd.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
31 Pon giù omai, pon giù ogne temenza; 32 volgiti in qua e vieni: entra sicuro!». 33 E io pur fermo e contra coscïenza.
query.error: **English:** 31 Lay down, lay down all fear; 32 turn here and come: enter securely!" 33 And I, still firm and against my conscience.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
34 Quando mi vide star pur fermo e duro, 35 turbato un poco disse: «Or vedi, figlio: 36 tra Bëatrice e te è questo muro».
query.error: **English:** 34 When he saw me standing still and firm, 35 somewhat troubled he said: "Now see, my son: 36 between Beatrice and you is this wall."
query.result: 34 Þa he geseah ðæt ic stod ðær swa stið and heard, 35 ða wearð he sumdeal gedrefed and cwæð: "Nu geseoh, min sunu: 36 betwux ðe and Beatrican is ðeos weall."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
37 Come al nome di Tisbe aperse il ciglio 38 Piramo in su la morte, e riguardolla, 39 allor che ’l gelso diventò vermiglio;
query.error: **English:** 37 As at the name of Thisbe Pyramus 38 opened his eyes at the point of death and looked at her, 39 at the moment when the mulberry tree turned red;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
40 così, la mia durezza fatta solla, 41 mi volsi al savio duca, udendo il nome 42 che ne la mente sempre mi rampolla.
query.error: **English:** 40 so, my hardness turned to joy, 41 I turned to the wise guide, hearing the name 42 that always springs to my mind.
query.result: 40 swa, min heardnes weard to lisse, 41 ic me wende to ðam wisan lareowe, ða ic ðone naman gehyrde, 42 ðe on ðam mode symle me rincð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
43 Ond’ ei crollò la fronte e disse: «Come! 44 volenci star di qua?»; indi sorrise 45 come al fanciul si fa ch’è vinto al pome.
query.error: **English:** 43 And he lowered his brow and said: "How now! 44 Do you wish to stay here?" Then he smiled 45 as one does to a child who is won over with an apple.
query.result: 43 Ond he hneop ða his neb and cwæð: "Hu nu! 44 woldest ðu her wunian?" ða he hine geglædde 45 swa mon ðæt cild deð ðe man mid æple geðwæð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
46 Poi dentro al foco innanzi mi si mise, 47 pregando Stazio che venisse retro, 48 che pria per lunga strada ci divise.
query.error: **English:** 46 Then he placed himself in front of me in the fire, 47 asking Statius to come behind, 48 who had previously separated us for a long stretch of road.
query.result: 46 Þa he hine innan fyr innan me sette, 47 bæd Staðium ðæt he him æfter come, 48 se ðe ær lange wegas us twegen on tu dyde.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
49 Sì com’ fui dentro, in un bogliente vetro 50 gittato mi sarei per rinfrescarmi, 51 tant’ era ivi lo ’ncendio sanza metro.
query.error: **English:** 49 As soon as I was inside, I would have thrown myself 50 into the boiling glass to cool myself, 51 so great was the fire there, beyond all measure.
query.result: 49 Swa swa ic wæs innan, on ðam hatan glæs, 50 ic wolde me wurpon ðær on to celianne, 51 swa micel wæs ðær ðæs fyres ungefoge.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
52 Lo dolce padre mio, per confortarmi, 53 pur di Beatrice ragionando andava, 54 dicendo: «Li occhi suoi già veder parmi».
query.error: **English:** 52 My sweet father, to comfort me, 53 kept talking only about Beatrice, 54 saying: "I seem to see her eyes already".
query.result: 52 Min leofa fæder, for ðon mec fremman, 53 be Beatrican sprecende wæs simle, 54 secgende: "Hire eagan ic ðinceð geseo nu".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
55 Guidavaci una voce che cantava 56 di là; e noi, attenti pur a lei, 57 venimmo fuor là ove si montava.
query.error: **English:** 55 A voice that sang was guiding us 56 from there; and we, paying attention only to it, 57 came forth to where one ascends.
query.result: 55 Lædde us ða forth on fæger fold 56 stefn stiðhycgende, ða we ðær stodon, 57 ðær monna mægen mæst geswiceð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
58 ‘Venite, benedicti Patris mei’, 59 sonò dentro a un lume che lì era, 60 tal che mi vinse e guardar nol potei.
query.error: **English:** 58 "Come, blessed of my Father," 59 resounded within a light that was there, 60 such that it overcame me and I could not look at it.
query.result: 58 "Cumað, ða gebletsodan mines Fæder," 59 wæs gesæd ðurh ðæt leoht ðe ðær wæs, 60 swa ðæt hit me oferwann and ic ne mihte ðær on locian.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
61 «Lo sol sen va», soggiunse, «e vien la sera; 62 non v’arrestate, ma studiate il passo, 63 mentre che l’occidente non si annera».
query.error: **English:** 61 "The sun is going down," he added, "and evening is coming; 62 do not stop, but quicken your pace, 63 while the west does not grow dark."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
64 Dritta salia la via per entro ’l sasso 65 verso tal parte ch’io toglieva i raggi 66 dinanzi a me del sol ch’era già basso.
query.error: **English:** 64 Straight rose the way within the rock 65 toward such a quarter that I took the rays 66 in front of me of the sun that was already low.
query.result: 64 Riht wæs se weg on ðam stane 65 ongean ðone stede ðe ic ða sunnan leoman 66 ongean me nam ðe ða læge wæs.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
67 E di pochi scaglion levammo i saggi, 68 che ’l sol corcar, per l’ombra che si spense, 69 sentimmo dietro e io e li miei saggi.
query.error: **English:** 67 And with few steps we climbed the bank, 68 so that we felt the sun setting behind us, 69 by the shadow that was extinguished, I and my wise companions.
query.result: 67 And we climbed the bank with few steps, 68 so that we felt the sun setting behind us, 69 by the shadow that was extinguished, I and my wise companions.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
88 Poco parer potea lì del di fori; 89 ma, per quel poco, vedea io le stelle 90 di lor solere e più chiare e maggiori.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
91 Sì ruminando e sì mirando in quelle, 92 mi prese il sonno; il sonno che sovente, 93 anzi che ’l fatto sia, sa le novelle.
query.error: **English:** 91 Thus pondering and gazing at those [stars], 92 sleep overcame me; sleep that often, 93 before the event happens, knows the news.
query.result: 91 Swa ðencende and ða steorran starende, 92 me nam ða slæp; se slæp ðe gelome, 93 ær ðæm ðe ðæt geweorðe, ða tiðende wat.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.

97 giovane e bella in sogno mi parea 98 donna vedere andar per una landa 99 cogliendo fiori; e cantando dicea:

100 «Sappia qualunque il mio nome dimanda 101 ch’i’ mi son Lia, e vo movendo intorno 102 le belle mani a farmi una ghirlanda.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
103 Per piacermi a lo specchio, qui m’addorno; 104 ma mia suora Rachel mai non si smaga 105 dal suo miraglio, e siede tutto giorno.
query.error: **English:** 103 To please myself in the mirror, here I adorn myself; 104 but my sister Rachel never moves 105 from her mirror, and sits there all day long.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
106 Ell’ è d’i suoi belli occhi veder vaga 107 com’ io de l’addornarmi con le mani; 108 lei lo vedere, e me l’ovrare appaga».
query.error: **English:** 106 She is as eager to see her beautiful eyes 107 as I am to adorn myself with my hands; 108 seeing her satisfies her, and working satisfies me.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
109 E già per li splendori antelucani, 110 che tanto a’ pellegrin surgon più grati, 111 quanto, tornando, albergan men lontani,
query.error: **English:** 109 And already, because of the light of dawn, 110 which rises more gratefully to pilgrims, 111 the more distant their lodging is on their return journey,
query.result: 109 And ða ðurh ða beorhtu antelucana, 110 ðe ðam æfterum wege swiðe ðanciende beoð, 111 swa ðe hi ðonne eft to ðam inneweardum cyrrað,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
112 le tenebre fuggian da tutti lati, 113 e ’l sonno mio con esse; ond’ io leva’mi, 114 veggendo i gran maestri già levati.
query.error: **English:** 112 the shadows were fleeing on all sides, 113 and my sleep with them; so I arose, 114 seeing the great masters already risen.
query.result: 112 ða ðystro ða flugon on ælce healfe, 113 and min slæp mid him; ða ic aras, 114 ða ic ða miclan lareowas ðær up arisene geseah.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
115 «Quel dolce pome che per tanti rami 116 cercando va la cura de’ mortali, 117 oggi porrà in pace le tue fami».
query.error: **English:** 115 "That sweet apple which for so many branches 116 the care of mortals goes seeking, 117 today will put your hunger to rest."
query.result: 115 "Þæt swete appel þe for so manige bogum 116 secað ðara deadlicra lacnað, 117 todæg gestilð ðine hungor."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
118 Virgilio inverso me queste cotali 119 parole usò; e mai non furo strenne 120 che fosser di piacere a queste iguali.
query.error: **English:** 118 Virgil turned to me with these words; 119 and never were gifts 120 that were equal to these in pleasure.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
121 Tanto voler sopra voler mi venne 122 de l’esser sù, ch’ad ogne passo poi 123 al volo mi sentia crescer le penne.
query.error: **English:** 121 Such desire came upon desire to be above, 122 that at each step thereafter 123 I felt my wings grow for the flight.
query.result: 121 Swa micel willa ofer willan me com 122 ðæs upheran ðæt ic æt æghwylcum færelde 123 feðrum me felde wexan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
124 Come la scala tutta sotto noi 125 fu corsa e fummo in su ’l grado superno, 126 in me ficcò Virgilio li occhi suoi,
query.error: **English:** 124 As soon as the entire staircase was run beneath us 125 and we were on the topmost step, 126 Virgil fixed his eyes on me,
query.result: 124 Swa swa ðæt stægeræfterealgeondæm 125 wæsætgædereornandwærononðæmheæhstanstæpe, 126 onmecFyrgilefæstnehisægan,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
127 e disse: «Il temporal foco e l’etterno 128 veduto hai, figlio; e se’ venuto in parte 129 dov’ io per me più oltre non discerno.
query.error: **English:** 127 and said: "You have seen the temporal fire and the eternal, 128 my son; and you have come to a place 129 where I myself can discern no further.
query.result: 127 cwæð:"Þutidlicefyrandætecelice 128 ðuhastgesewen,minsunu;andðuhæfsteoðe 129 ðærðeicðurhmeðmeðselnefurðorðiscerne."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
133 Vedi lo sol che ’n fronte ti riluce; 134 vedi l’erbette, i fiori e li arbuscelli 135 che qui la terra sol da sé produce.
query.error: **English:** 133 See the sun that shines upon your face; 134 see the grass, the flowers, and the shrubs 135 that the earth here produces all by itself.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
136 Mentre che vegnan lieti li occhi belli 137 che, lagrimando, a te venir mi fenno, 138 seder ti puoi e puoi andar tra elli.
query.error: **English:** 136 While your beautiful eyes, 137 which, weeping, made me come to you, 138 are joyful, you can sit down and walk among them.
query.result: 136 Þenden ðe ða beorhtan eagan cumað, 137 ða ðe wepende mec to ðe brohton, 138 ðu ðe mæge settan and ðe mæge gangan betwux him.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
139 Non aspettar mio dir più né mio cenno; 140 libero, dritto e sano è tuo arbitrio, 141 e fallo fora non fare a suo senno:
query.error: **English:** 139 Do not expect me to say more or give you a sign; 140 your free will is straight and healthy, 141 and it would be wrong not to act according to its judgment:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
142 per ch’io te sovra te corono e mitrio».
query.error: **English:** 142 therefore I crown and miter you over yourself.
query.result: 142 and ðu eart nu freoh to farenne swa ðu wille.
